page.title: 13EAST HETTON COLLIERY
page.content: Known as Kelloe Pit, it was a working colliery.G.R 345 370. Now all that remains are some surface buildings and the heaps.The heaps are going to be flattened out soon.Most of the buildings have been knocked down and there are only bricks left.The machines have been salvaged.The only buildings working are the washeries. The colliery has a history of floding. In 1983 the colliery was developing a new seam, It was underneath the Tilley Seam which belonged to the now closed Thornley Colliery.When they started drilling, water began coming through the hole.The officials were worried. They withdrew the men from the seams. East Hetton Colliery was closed.Some of the men were transferred to coastal collieries.At our school we are hoping to set up a museum.We have got tools,photographs and other documents.
